triples.name: GPT-4
triples.relevance: GPT-4 is the core large language model used as the automated tool for qualitative data analysis in this study.

triples.name: Prompt engineering
triples.relevance: The paper proposes novel prompt engineering strategies (Zero-shot, Few-shot, Few-shot with context) for optimizing GPT-4's performance on qualitative coding tasks.

triples.name: Zero-shot learning
triples.relevance: Zero-shot prompting is one of three novel prompt engineering strategies tested to code educational datasets without prior examples.

triples.name: Few-shot learning
triples.relevance: Few-shot prompting with and without contextual information is proposed as a strategy to improve GPT-4's coding performance using a limited number of examples.

triples.name: Word embedding
triples.relevance: Embeddings are used as one of the novel approaches tested for representing and coding qualitative data in the study.

triples.name: Inter-rater reliability
triples.relevance: Inter-rater reliability metrics are used to evaluate GPT-4's coding performance by comparing agreement with human coders.

triples.name: Educational game
triples.relevance: Game-based learning environments provide one of the three educational datasets used for evaluating GPT-4's coding performance.

triples.name: Educational technology
triples.relevance: The paper applies large language models to educational technology research for automating qualitative data analysis in multiple educational contexts.
